metadata.synopsis: In this scene, Gale is conjuring an image of Mystra over the palm of his hand, staring at the goddess he’s love with, but who abandoned him. When the player approaches, he dispels the image and he feels embarrassed to have been caught doing what he was doing. The conversation turns to his passion for magic however, and he invites the player to try to cast a spell with him together. The player can do so by passing through various stages of spell casting, and when successful, this can lead to a first player-initiated romantic moment with Gale.

163.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Gale holds out his arm. Above the palm of his hand is conjured in gold-coloured magic the image of a woman, the goddess Mystra. He's looking at the figure intensely.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Is that Mystra I see in the palm of your hands? An ambitious spell indeed.

44.speaker: Gale
44.text: Oh! My, you startled me. I... I was miles away.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Startled, he dispells it.NodeContext: Gale is looking at a miniature magical projection of Mystra he's created in his hand in his hand. Startled, he dispells it.

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: Of course, of course. I was just... practising an incantation.

168.speaker: Gale
168.text: I do - because it's through practice that I seek to perfect. To augment.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: I'll leave you to it then. Good night.

32.speaker: Gale
32.context: NodeContext: Distracted. Still miles away in his head.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: There's more to it than that. The figure I saw: she means something to you.

71.speaker: Gale
71.context: NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

216.speaker: Gale
216.text: I can't quite describe it, the need I sometimes feel to see her - to draw the filaments of fantasy into existence.

67.speaker: Gale
67.text: No sculpture or painting could ever do her justice, only the fabric that she herself is and embodies:

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: Mystra is all magic. And as far as I'm concerned, she is all creation.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: I didn't realise the depth of your devotion.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: You sound like a smitten school boy.

251.speaker: Gale
251.text: It is a kind of love after all; at the very least a most deep seated passion.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: You're deluded, Gale. There's more to life than one goddess.

187.speaker: Player
187.text: I quite agree. There's no greater deity than Mystra.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: You speak a great truth. No other god other comes close to her divinity.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Careful, Gale. The other gods are just as important. My own, for example.

100.speaker: Gale
100.text: No, but you do understand, don't you?

27.speaker: Gale
27.text: Magic is... my life. I've been in touch with the Weave for as long as I can remember. There's nothing like it.

194.speaker: Gale
194.text: It's like music, poetry, physical beauty all rolled into one and given expression through the senses.

15.speaker: Gale
15.text: That is why I asked you to seek me out, to offer you a taste of such wonders. Would you like me to show you?

209.speaker: Gale
209.text: Would you like to experience this?

137.speaker: Player
137.text: I'd be glad to try, though I normally commune with Mystra through prayer.

131.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Gale walks around behind the player (as though teaching them to fly a kite) and makes a delicate gesture with both hands.

234.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player imitates the gesture. There’s a first visual effect. Some sparks of magic start to appear around the player and Gale.

243.speaker: Narrator
243.text: *A familiar feeling - like a kind word and a kind touch at the same time. It's warm and comfortable.*

231.speaker: Player
231.text: Imitate the gesture quickly and decisively.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Imitate the gesture slowly and as precisely as you can.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Imitate the gesture with a flourish.

211.speaker: Narrator
211.text: *You feel something strange - like a kind word and a kind touch at the same time. It's warm and comfortable.*

110.speaker: Gale
110.text: Excellent. Now repeat after me: Ah-Thran Mystra-Ryl Kantrach-Ao.
110.context: NodeContext: The line can be read just like the words appear, but with some mystical gravitas in the pronunciation. I picture this spoken the way Morgana speaks the Charm of Making in the following clip from Excalibur: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ttq_4FwvLJo&gl=BE (First result when searching for “excalibur charm of making” on youtube.)

169.speaker: Player
169.text: An easy incantation. Simply repeat after Gale.

199.context: CinematicNodeContext: The visual effect intensifies. There’s the start of a glow, of a rush of beautiful magic.

190.speaker: Narrator
190.text: *Ah, yes: the scent of rosewater and a sense of wellbeing. A sliver of Weave that tastes sweet on the tongue.*

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Repeat the words, slowly, but carefully.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: You sense power in these words. Speak them deliberately.

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *Suddenly: the scent of rosewater and a sense of wellbeing. A sliver of Weave that tastes sweet on the tongue.*

218.speaker: Gale
218.text: Very good. Now I want you to picture in your mind the concept of harmony. As true as you can.

208.speaker: Player
208.text: Recede into the calm centre of your mind, just like you were taught at the academy.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Still your mind. Focus on Mystra's grace. Her power. The peace you find in following her wisdom.

223.speaker: Player
223.text: Sink deep into your magic. It is who you are. It is home.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Harmony comes easily to you. Allow it to wash over your mind and magic.

53.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player and Gale are now fully enveloped in a magic glow - a protective field of beautiful magic. Unconsciously player steps back closer to Gale.

123.speaker: Narrator
123.text: *You see - or is it sense? - the unmistakable presence of Mystra, the Lady of Mysteries.*

233.speaker: Narrator
233.text: *There's something like the anticipation of a kiss, then the pleasure of being cloaked in peace.*

154.speaker: Narrator
154.text: *You are safe. You are nestled in the cup of Mystra's hand.*

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *You are safe. You are nestled in the cup of her hand.*

68.speaker: Gale
68.text: Look at that. We're channelling the Weave. How does it feel?

159.speaker: Gale
159.text: You did it. You're channelling the Weave. How does it feel?

214.speaker: Player
214.text: Incredible. Though of course, I could have managed it by myself...

17.speaker: Gale
17.text: You're hard to please, aren't you?

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *The Weave connects you. The moment feels intimate.*

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Hold on to the moment. It's a good night for intimacy.

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *You realise the Weave is making you one. You have but to imagine your desire, and Gale will know it.*
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: The magic glow is at its peak. It makes the player and Gale look like the only people in the world, safe in their own miniature dimension.

228.speaker: Player
228.text: Picture kissing him. With tenderness. Then, with passion.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Picture a romantic walk, your hand slipped within Gale's.

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *You perceive quick-fire gusts of embarrassment, trepidation, and finally... elation.*

244.speaker: Gale
244.text: Sorry, I wasn't expecting... But it is a pleasant image to be sure!

183.speaker: Gale
183.text: Most pleasant, in fact. Most welcome.

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *The Weave evaporates, and as it does so, you realise the night feels suddenly cold and lonesome.*
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: All that beautiful magic slips away, and as it does, the player and Gale find themselves in the here and now again.

99.speaker: Gale
99.text: There it goes. How easily things slip away from us, no matter how hard they were in the obtaining.
99.context: NodeContext: The weave disappears – he says this with a passionate melancholy.

46.speaker: Gale
46.text: Good night. I enjoyed sharing a moment of magic with you.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: Picture a hearty meal with Gale, food and friendship flowing between you.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Picture kicking him in the gut.

41.speaker: Gale
41.context: NodeContext: Gale and the player are bonded by the Weave, allowing the player to conjure an image in Gale’s head that projects your feelings towards him. In this node, the player pictured hitting him in the stomach, which he does not quite appreciate.

252.speaker: Gale
252.text: There it goes. I suppose a blow to the stomach upsets the Weave as much as it would me.

103.speaker: Gale
103.text: I'm going to bed. Perhaps this was all a mistake.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: Picture his severed head on a spike.

222.speaker: Gale
222.text: Good gods, what on earth makes you picture that?
222.context: NodeContext: Gale and the player are bonded by the Weave, allowing the player to conjure an image in Gale’s head that projects your feelings towards him. In this node, the player pictured Gale’s head on a spike. He is surprised, hurt, angry and disgusted all at once.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Picture nothing. This is a bad idea.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: A satisfying end to a wondrous experience. It's time to let go.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: You're in no mood to be so close to Gale. Release your grasp on the Weave.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: It's not quite like praying to her. She feels closer, somehow.

226.speaker: Gale
226.text: Quite so. The Weave is a sensitive conduit.

247.speaker: Player
247.text: It's different, but I can definitely feel a divine kind of presence.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: It feels like a good time to call it a night.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Think of the here and now: this unexpected moment of learning.

220.speaker: Player
220.text: Picture a place of utter peace, away from all harm and the mayhem of civilisation.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Recall a memory of early youth, a happy family moment.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Try to hum a familiar tune.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Picture the perfect darkness - to be in the womb of Shar.

202.speaker: Narrator
202.text: *You see - or is it sense? - the presence of a woman, the woman who hovered over Gale's palm.*

182.speaker: Player
182.text: That's too abstract for my tastes. Let's just forget about it, shall we?

153.speaker: Gale
153.text: I think it's a mistake to give up on the brink of success, but I cannot force your hand.

215.speaker: Player
215.text: Repeat the words, bold and proud.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: Belt the words with a little flourish on 'Ao'.

179.speaker: Player
179.text: Actually, I dislike tongue twisters. Let's just call it a night.

84.speaker: Gale
84.text: Not quite. But this is the easy part. Shall we try again?

206.speaker: Player
206.text: Imitate the gesture again. Find the magic in the movement.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Attempt the gesture again. Give it more flair.

125.speaker: Gale
125.text: No, I'm sorry, but it looks like magic's not on the cards tonight. Perhaps I'm not quite the teacher I fancy myself to be.
125.context: NodeContext: The player failed to perform the necessary steps involved in spell casting. You really wanted the player to succeed, but alas.

121.speaker: Gale
121.text: In any case, don't blame yourself. Mystra can be a fickle mistress. As I'm sure you're aware.

143.speaker: Gale
143.text: In any case, don't blame yourself. Mystra can be a fickle mistress. Coy to a tee.

232.speaker: Player
232.text: No, thanks. Not my cup of tea, clearly.

250.speaker: Gale
250.text: I think it's a mistake to give up so easily, but I cannot force your hand.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Actually, never mind. Magic is just not for me.

56.speaker: Gale
56.text: I think it's a mistake to hold that conviction, but I cannot force your hand.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Magic normally comes to me through prayer, but I don't mind trying.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: No, I have no interest in such magic.

91.speaker: Gale
91.text: Disinterest is such a disheartening condition.

63.speaker: Gale
63.text: Always a pity when opportunities slip us by.

144.speaker: Gale
144.text: Is it the same for you?

112.speaker: Gale
112.text: Perhaps we can share the experience by reaching into the Weave together.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: It's getting late. Perhaps another time.

227.speaker: Player
227.text: It's different for me. Not quite so intense.

65.speaker: Gale
65.text: You wouldn't say that if you felt what I feel.

240.speaker: Gale
240.text: Perhaps I can show you what I mean by reaching into the Weave together.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Magic is music, poetry, and beauty. Though I suspect you and I perform it differently.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Magic is like music. But while you need it written down, I can play by ear.

191.speaker: Gale
191.text: Fair enough - though in the end we're still playing the same composition.

210.speaker: Player
210.text: My magic is both ancient and raw. Sometimes even volatile.

94.speaker: Gale
94.text: Yes - as raw and ancient as the veins of Bahamut.

192.speaker: Gale
192.text: Still, it is magic in its purest, most essential rapture that I'm trying to impart.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: It's less 'music and poetry', and more 'I hope I don't blow up'.

176.speaker: Gale
176.text: Believe it or not, I can relate.
176.context: NodeContext: said with a wry grin

200.speaker: Player
200.text: How narrow-minded. Magic goes far, far beyond Mystra.

213.speaker: Gale
213.text: Pish posh. One might as well deny one's mother's womb as the cradle of life.

238.speaker: Gale
238.text: You read too much into it. I was merely indulging in my passion.

253.speaker: Gale
253.text: More or less. I was lost in... prayer of all things.

156.speaker: Gale
156.text: Mystra, for indeed it was her image I conjured, commands all magic. Salvation, if such a thing exists, is hers to bestow or withhold.

38.speaker: Gale
38.text: Mystra commands all magic. Salvation, if such a thing exists, is hers to bestow or withhold.

242.speaker: Gale
242.text: And yet, even now, more than I fear losing my own self and soul, I fear losing my command of her art.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I thought you wanted to show me something. Was that it?

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Whatever this is, save it for tomorrow. We have a long day ahead of us.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: The figure you conjured: who is she? Someone you miss?

198.speaker: Gale
198.text: No, no. She's no one, really. I was just... practising an incantation.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: You don't have that look on your face when you're looking at 'no one'.

140.speaker: Gale
140.text: What can I say? She's... She's Mystra.
140.context: NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

75.speaker: Gale
75.text: In a manner of speaking, yes. I was lost in prayer of all things.

246.speaker: Gale
246.text: Someone I miss and... lost, I suppose.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Care to tell me why you were conjuring an image of the goddess?

26.speaker: Gale
26.text: No special reason, really. I was just... practising an incantation.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: There's more to it than that. You were contemplating her in a way I can hardly fathom.

236.speaker: Gale
236.text: For the seldom purpose of prayer.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Were you praying to your goddess? If so, I'd be glad to join your vigil.

114.speaker: Gale
114.text: Not praying. Not quite. I was just... practising an incantation.
114.context: NodeContext: He was recalling Mystra as a lover, but doesn't say that out loud.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: No, there's more to it than that. I know devotion when I see it.

161.speaker: Gale
161.text: I'm no cleric, like you are. It's different for a wizard.

51.speaker: Gale
51.text: I'm no paladin, like you are. It's different for a wizard.

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: So I was, praying she'd aid me.

25.speaker: Gale
25.text: So I was. Praying - though perhaps more accurately: pleading.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: A well-crafted illusion. Mystra would no doubt approve.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: That's the deity you wizards adore. Mystra, right?

249.speaker: Player
249.text: Cut it out. That spell of yours is attracting mosquitos.
